Articles.Content:
Okay, so I need a mod/part sorter. I have WAY more mods than I can or will ever use on a single craft, even multi-part ones. Then again, I also like doing stuff stock for ease of sharing. I need yet another mod (the irony) to sort my others.

Requirements:

It must work through an in-game interface in the editors; no exterior clients.

It must be able to sort by mod pack and show/hide only the ones I want.

It should be relatively bug free (I have used some buggy ones).

It should not cause a momentary freeze when showing/hiding parts.

3 and 4 rule out two of these that I know of and have experimented with. The one I have now is very buggy and doesn't work half the time. The one I used to use causes 10 second freezes when showing/hiding mods, which is not tolerable on m livestream. I have cooler things to do than wait for my parts list to update.
Try Part Catalog. It's one of the most popular part sorters.
That is the one I am actually using right now but I find it very buggy. It doesn't work half the time.
There was Simple Part Organizer too. It should still work for 0.21.
Part Catalog works nicely for me - I actually find it more user-friendly than Simple Part Catalog. The only feature I'd like to see added is the ability to sort/hide parts by size.

There was Simple Part Organizer too. It should still work for 0.21.

I tried this too but it's flaw is it updates every time you click a pack and causes up to 10 second freezes when updating, which renders it unusable for me because that is unacceptable on livestream. Part of my problem is I have a very large mod load.
